title: Ignore edge-nuclei
desc: Should nuclei at the image edges be ignored?

title: Image Padding
desc: Which image padding should be applied?

title: Reduce oversegmentation
desc: Should NucDetect try to reduce oversegmentation?

title: Assess image quality
desc: Should the image quality be assessed before analysis?

title: Use Hough transform (experimental)
desc: Should Hough transform be used to identify nuclei and foci?

title: Minimal nucleus size - X axis
desc: The minimal horizontal expansion of the nuclei

title: Minimal nucleus size - Y axis
desc: The minimal vertical expansion of the nuclei

title: Minimal foci size - X axis
desc: The minimal horizontal expansion of the foci

title: Minimal foci size - Y axis
desc: The minimal vertical expansion of the foci

title: Thresholding percentage
desc: The thresholding percentage used to identify foci

title: Thresholding ignore percentage
desc: The percentage of pixels to ignore during the analysis. Used to account for outliers

title: Minimal intensity value
desc: The minimal intensity value for a pixel to be considered part of a focus

title: Results saved in csv
desc: Determines if the analysis results will be saved in a csv file.

title: Results printed to console
desc: Determines if the analysis results will be printed into the console.

title: Result formatting
desc: Determines if the analysis results will be formatted before printing.

title: Image annotation
desc: Determines if result image will be annotated

title: Snapshot saving
desc: Determines if the analysis snapshots (such as threshold images) will be saved and thus be accessible after analysis.
